comments:
I had just imported a java src project
(the org.eclipse.swt.examples_2.1.0).
Then I clicked on one of the visual tree
controls - a package icon in the tree display
of the project.
Eclipse crashed.

Following are the logs for 
	crashreporter, and
	.metadata/

This was on Mac OS 10.2.2

==========================================================

Alan,
Which version of Eclipse were you running?
Can you reproduce the crash by repeating the steps you described?
Does it happen with other projects you import?
Thanks,
Chris

Closing PR for now, on the assumption that this is caused by a low memory 
situation. This is consistent with the VM crashing after the OS requesting the 
app to shutdown (see Display.close in stack trace).
Alan, please reopen if you can repeat the problem and not run into an out of 
memory/out of space situation.

Was sent to my own mail box. Pasted to the bug report.

Christophe,

It is the Nov 15 build of Eclipse, v. 2.1, Build id: 200211151436.

I am attempting to replicate, but crashed before I got there. Currently 
pursuing the idea that 200 MB of free space on the boot drive, with 256 
MB of RAM, on Mac OS X may have contributed to the problem. But will 
try and replicate.

This was the first import I had tried for awhile. Since it was a stock 
example off of the eclipse.org website, I assumed it would go smooth 
and it did not.

Thanks,

Alan Hawrelak
